found conversation:

the problem is ac_reward was 0

Author: Alright#0419
Content: ac_reward is denominated in satoshis not coins

Author: Alright#0419
Content: ac_reward=0.0001 will surely bug out

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: I set ac_end=1 and ac_reward=0.0001

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do -ac_end=1 -ac_reward=1

Author: Alright#0419
Content: or no -ac_reward at all if you want on-demand blocks

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: but on-demand blocks will lead to a 0.0001 miner reward by default

Author: Alright#0419
Content: ac_reward is definitely going to bug out because you're trying to set the block reward to 0.000000000001

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yes but ac_end will stop those .0001 block rewards

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
don't know, feel more comfortable if i see matchings like these in the code
```OP_NOP2 = OP_CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY```
or if `dash-cli getblockchaininfo` shows me
```      "id": "bip65",
      "version": 4,
      "enforce": {
        "status": true,
        "found": 1000,
        "required": 750,
        "window": 1000
      },
      "reject": {
        "status": true,
        "found": 1000,
        "required": 950,
        "window": 1000
      }```

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
the requirement was there from the beginning... all coins that i added to BarterDEX have the BIP implemented, i always checked that
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ezXr4DBctFy6o4t-C_jCa4BpKBfXN4nCqxcCkx6hl9g/edit#gid=232944181

Author: danielkaye#6246

Author: cipi#4502
Content: my personal conclusion is that if you don't find CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY in the code, then it is not implemented... i don't know why it worked for PIVX without, but i would not implement coins without BIP65... worst case is that you loose the security from the atomic swap protocol, not sure
